newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: CRICKET-BICHEL STRIKES TO ROUT PAKISTAN.
newsitem.headline: CRICKET-BICHEL STRIKES TO ROUT PAKISTAN.

text.p: Australia fast bowler Andrew Bichel tore through the top order as Pakistan staggered to a meagre 149 all out in their limited overs World Series match on Tuesday.
The tourists were dominated throughout by an Australian pace attack that exploited a lively pitch to dismiss their opponents in 45.2 overs of their 50-over quota at Bellerive Oval.
Bichel, playing in only his second one-day international, set the tone with his first ball when he trapped opener Zahoor Elahi leg before wicket for a duck.
Fellow opener Aamir Sohail and number three Ijaz Ahmed were also dismissed without scoring as Pakistan slumped to a dismal seven for three in the fourth over.
Despite a battling half-century from Mohammad Wasim, Pakistan were unable to recover their poise or momentum after those early setbacks.
Wasim, batting at number five, scored 54 to save his side from an abject surrender before his became the sixth wicket to fall with the total on 116.
Wasim, the only batsman to look at all comfortable, eventually fell when he edged a delivery from leg-spinner Shane Warne to Australia captain Mark Taylor at first slip.
But it was Australia's pace bowlers who proved almost unplayable at times as they extracted bounce and movement from a damp pitch.
Pakistan's early troubles raised questions over captain Wasim Akram's judgement after he won the toss and elected to bat in overcast conditions.
Bichel finished with economical figures of three for 17 from his ten overs after adding number three Ijaz and middle order batsman Mujahid Jamshed to his list of victims.
